intro: Uvedalia nana, commonly known as the dwarf uvedalia, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, oval-shaped leaves and clusters of white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodland floors and wetlands. Its compact size and delicate appearance make it a popular choice for native plant gardens. Uvedalia nana plays a role in supporting local pollinators and maintaining ecological balance in its habitat.
